meanings.definition: An accounting practice of recording an asset as having no value.
meanings.sent1: The company made a writeoff for the old machinery that was no longer usable.
meanings.sent2: The accountant advised the business owner to include the writeoff in the financial statements.
meanings.sent3: The writeoff of the outdated inventory made the accountant chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The writeoff of the abandoned project was like erasing a mistake from the books.
meanings.sent5: The writeoff of the damaged goods was necessary to keep the financial records accurate.

meanings.definition: A reduction in the value of an asset for tax purposes.
meanings.sent1: The writeoff of the property's value helped lower the tax burden for the company.
meanings.sent2: The accountant explained the benefits of a writeoff to minimize tax liabilities.
meanings.sent3: The writeoff of the investment property brought a smile to the tax preparer's face.
meanings.sent4: The writeoff of the vehicle's depreciation was a strategic move to save money.
meanings.sent5: The writeoff of the equipment's value was a smart financial decision for the business.
